name: cadmium chloride production, semiconductor-grade | cadmium chloride, semiconductor-grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/477/documentation

This datasets describes the production of high-grade cadmium chloride (99.999%) from cadmium and hydrochloric acid. This purity of cadmium chloride can be used in the production of thin film solar cells. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The activity starts with the reception of the raw materials at the plant gate.

The activity ends with the produced cadmium chloride. The energy consumption, emissions and transports are estimated.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production of cadmium chloride by reaction of cadmium with hydrogen chloride
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Cadmium emissions are extrapolated from cadmium purification.

exchanges.description:
The cadmium is assumed to be transported 200 km by rail. This is the standard rail transport distance for the US (see table 4.2, p. 635/926 in Classen et al., 2009).

References:
Classen M., Althaus H.-J., Blaser S., Tuchschmid M., Jungbluth N., Doka G., Faist Emmenegger M. and Scharnhorst W. (2009) Life Cycle Inventories of Metals. Final report ecoinvent data v2.1, No 10.
